newsitem.title: USA: Alexion drug blocks blood vessel damage.
newsitem.headline: Alexion drug blocks blood vessel damage.

text.p: Alexion Pharmaceuticals Inc said on Monday that a study found that Alexion's C5 Inhibitor blocks damage to blood vessel cells after heart attacks.
The study was conducted by Dr. Gregory Stahl, an assistant professor of anesthesia at Harvard Medical School, Alexion said.

Stahl's model showed that the drug was able to prevent the damage from swelling blood vessels after they are deprived of oxygen and then reoxygenated. Blood vessel walls often swell and are damaged from the swelling after heart attacks and strokes, Alexion said.
The drug is presently being tested in a phase I/II clinical trial in patients undergoing cardiopulmonary bypasses, Alexion said.
